title: Hospitality manager
overviewOfRole: Working across a variety of organisations focusing on ensuring excellent customer experience.
occupationalSummary: Hospitality managers work across a huge variety of organisations including bars, restaurants, cafés, conference centres, banqueting venues, hotels and contract caterers. These managers generally specialise in a particular area, however their core knowledge, skills and behaviours are aligned. Common to all managers in this role is their passion for exceeding customers’ expectations. Hospitality managers have a high level of responsibility and are accountable for fulfilling the business vision and objectives which requires excellent business, people and customer relation skills. Individuals in this role are highly motivated team leaders that combine a talent for management and specific industry skills and thrive on the customer facing nature of the role.

knowledges.detail: C:Understand how to use relevant operating models to help achieve the business vision and objectives of hospitality businesses and how these are used in own area of business
C:Understand how to manage finance and minimise costs within hospitality businesses; identify the income streams and cost centres and areas for potential waste or loss within own area of business
C:Know the business strategy and its key competitors and how it fits within the wider hospitality industry in which it operates
C:Identify the management information available in own area and understand how to use, analyse and act on it to drive business change
C:Understand the standard business operating procedures, the services and products and how they are managed and their potential consequences
C:Identify peaks and troughs in business levels and understand the factors which influence them e.g. season, weather, cultural and special occasions such as Valentine’s Day, New Years
C:Determine how to develop contingency plans which allow consistent levels of service in line with business standards and requirements
C:Understand how technology supports the delivery of products and services in hospitality businesses
C:Understand environmental, legislative and social responsibilities and their impact within hospitality businesses
C:Know how to identify potential risks to people and the business and how to plan for and minimise the impact
C:Understand how to create a people strategy and how to effectively manage recruitment, induction, team development and succession planning in a hospitality business to deliver it
C:Know and understand how to consistently communicate and engage with people and teams
C:Understand the responsibilities of an employer and the parameters the business works within
C:Determine the customer service journey and understand how to meet expectations, taking into account business requirements
C:Understand the impact of service failure on hospitality businesses and identify how to develop and implement successful service recovery strategies
C:Know how to use customer feedback as a competitive tool in the hospitality industry
C:Understand how to identify, support, implement and evaluate hospitality marketing, sales strategies and techniques
C:Understand what it means to champion the business and maintain comprehensive product / service, brand and market knowledge
C:Understand the management and leadership styles and skills required in a hospitality business environment
C:Understand how to lead the implementation of change in hospitality business and the potential impact on stakeholders
C:Understand the ethos of a diverse and inclusive culture that demonstrates social inclusion

O1:Know key ingredients, preparation, cooking and service methods of menu items and communicate relevant information to team members. Understand the benefits of food and beverage matching and how to maximise sales through effective menu design, seasonal promotions and themes. Understand different food service styles and when each is applied most effectively
O1:Understand how effective management and maintenance of food service equipment, accompaniments and drinks products impact on the business
O2:Understand how to monitor the cleanliness and presentation of the establishment and productivity, identify and implement areas for improvement
O2:Know requirements for current and forecast linen stock and other housekeeping supplies and know how to manage these to ensure sufficient supply to meet demand
O2:Understand how to identify, prioritise, schedule and implement maintenance or repair work in ways which minimise disruption to customers and impact on other areas of the business
O3:Understand how to allocate and manage rooms to maximise sales opportunities for the business and meet or exceed customer expectations
O3:Understand how to monitor the effectiveness of reception and reservation systems, identify and implement areas for improvement
O4:Identify the information relevant to the reservations process and understand how to analyse, interpret and use it to drive revenue generation
O4:Understand how to gather reliable information on competitor performance and make business / industry comparisons, recognising the importance to the business
O4:Understand how to carry out and recognise the importance of effective yield management
O4:Understand how to work with other managers and use relevant and available information to forecast potential revenue performance
O5:Understand how to plan and implement multiple events to ensure best allocation and use of resources to meet demand
O5:Identify required business levels and know how to track and analyse enquiries to fulfil them
O5:Understand how to develop and maintain effective working relationships with suppliers, exhibitors and other stakeholders and why this is important for the business
O6:Understand how to manage the delivery of on and off site sales of goods and products
O6:Understand how to monitor food production to ensure standards are upheld, identify and implement areas for improvement
O6:Understand how to manage cleanliness and identify, prioritise, schedule and implement maintenance or repair work in ways which minimise disruption to customers

O7:Understand the process for procurement of food ingredients and commodities, including purchasing specifications. Know how to prepare menus, recipes and standardised systems and procedures to ensure consistency and quality of food
O7:Understand the requirement for and on-going maintenance for kitchen equipment. Know how, why and when staff should be trained and monitored on its use.

O7:Understand how to manage food safety systems in line with current legislative requirements and identify, prioritise, schedule and implement monitoring, training, maintenance or repair work in ways which minimise disruption to customers;

O8:Know the interdependence required of the functions within the business and how to plan the work of the team and its resources to address each of these requirements to deliver products and services on time and in line with customer needs and business / brand standards. Understand the need to plan across a number of different functions and the potential implications of delivering a multi-functional approach on customer experience, team performance and future business and team objectives. Adapt to changing customer, team or business demands, responding to the immediate situation and considering longer term solutions

O8:Understand how the needs of the customer and skills of the team differ from one function to another and how to ensure each function is delivered to maximise customer experience and achieve business objectives

behaviours.detail: C:Inspire team members to demonstrate personal drive to achieve the business vision and objectives
C:Be financially astute in work activities, visibly discourage waste and act credibly on matters that affect business finance
C:Openly share information with colleagues that support business objectives and growth
C:Make decisions based on a sound analysis and judgement of available management information

C:Ability to make accurate forecasts based on current and future trends
C:Think ahead and demonstrate resourcefulness when developing plans
C:Use technology responsibly and take an interest in new developments that could support the business
C:Be accountable, advocate and adhere to the importance of working legally in the best interest of all people
C:Be solution focussed through proactive risk management personally and through others
C:Demonstrate commitment to self-improvement, championing a culture of continual development and progression; trying out and reflecting on methods to develop own leadership skills
C:Manage team to take a pride in their role through demonstrating a consistently positive and professional approach to communication
C:Empower team members whilst providing adequate support to aid their decision making
C:Proactively develop and maintain a customer centred culture
C:Provide clear direction to team and empower them to implement effective customer service resolutions
C:Drive behavioural change through encouraging others to seek and act on feedback
C:Personally market the business and industry through creating a culture of passionate enthusiasm to provide customers with the best possible experience, seeking and acting upon feedback
C:Drive a strong cultural belief in the brand and product / service
C:Create a high performance culture
C:Pioneer business decisions and promote a positive attitude to change
C:Lead by example to promote business and social responsibility and act as a role model to ensure self and team are operating in an empathic, fair and consistently professional manner
O1:Demonstrate passion for high quality food and drink products and service
O2:Actively seek innovative ideas for improving the physical presentation of the establishment in line with business constraints
O3:Demonstrate consistently high standards of personal presentation and conduct, and instil the same values in the team
O4:Demonstrate the ability to identify commercial opportunity to maximise revenue for the business across the different functions and departments of the business
O5:Is highly organised and proactive, anticipating and solving problems quickly to ensure stakeholder satisfaction
O6:Actively seek opportunities to improve the commercial presentation of the outlet to enhance and maximise sales
O7:Lead the department with passion, instilling a sense of pride in team ensuring a consistently high quality and efficient food production operation

skills.detail: C:Proactively seek and drive activities that support the achievement of the business vision and objectives, improve competitiveness, to meet financial targets
C:Monitor and manage income and costs, use forecasting to set realistic targets, evaluate the control of resource allocation, and prepare financial cases for improvement projects
C:Develop and effectively communicate own plans and strategy to management team in order to harmoniously work towards achieving business objectives

C:Analyse, interpret and evaluate product / service sales and / or productivity data and information and use it to make recommendations for future planning e.g. of staff and resources, ideas for new initiatives, and drive business change
C:Implement required operational processes and procedures in line with business standards
C:Monitor peaks and troughs in business levels to ensure operational plans allow service standards and resources to be maintained
C:Develop and implement contingency plans to ensure resources are in place to provide consistent levels of service required by the business
C:Maximise the use of technology and evaluate its effectiveness for achieving the desired results
C:Manage and continuously review adherence to legislation
C:Identify and manage risks through empowering the team

C:Carry out talent management planning in line with the people strategy, and develop a culture of continuous development, actively supporting team members to improve and grow within their roles and careers
C:Demonstrate effective methods of communication and leadership that achieve the desired results, providing support and coaching to team members to maximise their performance
C:Manage people performance and capability, and develop teams in line with operational policy and procedures and support appropriate decision making
C:Monitor customer satisfaction to ensure product / service is delivered according to their profile and business requirements
C:Develop and implement service recovery strategies to uphold brand / business reputation and maintain customer satisfaction
C:Actively seek, analyse and evaluate customer feedback and take appropriate action to improve quality of service and customer experience
C:Maximise the impact of marketing strategies, evaluate and act on feedback
C:Manage the targeted promotion of the brand and product / service to customers
C:Use a wide range of management and leadership skills appropriate to the business to motivate and inspire others
C:Lead change to meet the business objectives and manage the impact of change on stakeholders
C:Support team members to carry out work activities that respond to a diverse range of needs

O1:Ensure food and beverage service operation meets business / brand standard at all times through its staff, facilities, menus and equipment. Ensure the beverage offer complements menus and maximises sales, delivering a service that will enhance business opportunities, e.g. seasonal special offers, promoting a themed drinks menu to complement dishes
O1:Manage the storage and maintenance of food service equipment, accompaniments and beverage products to deliver the best result to customers and maximum profit to the business

O2:Monitor standards of cleanliness, presentation and productivity, identifying trends and opportunities to enhance the housekeeping service e.g. to achieve improved cleanliness and attractiveness in line with the style of the business (e.g. colour scheme of seasonal floral displays)
O2:Track the use of housekeeping supplies and linen on and off- site taking action to ensure sufficient stock for current and anticipated demand, minimise loss and wastage
O2:Determine the need for and schedule maintenance or repair work, managing its impact on the housekeeping service and other areas of the business
O3:Manage the availability and sale of rooms and / or facilities to maximise revenue and meet customers’ individual needs
O3:Analyse the reception and reservation systems and performance, identifies and implement improvement, e.g. to reduce guest waiting times, minimise check-in / check-out congestion
O4:Analyse and present a range of complex information and provide intelligence, for example on revenue in relation to market factors
O4:Monitor competitor performance and business / industry  comparisons
O4:Carry out effective yield management in line with business requirements
O4:Forecast potential revenue performance in collaboration with other managers
O5:Manage the planning and delivery of multiple events
O5:Track and analyse enquiries to fulfil forecast business levels
O5:Manage relationships with a variety of organisations and stakeholders such as suppliers and exhibitors
O6:Manage the delivery of on and off site sales of goods and products
O6:Manage food production to established standards and where relevant according to brand specifications, ensuring that all food safety practices are followed
O6:Maintain the appearance of the establishment to business standards managing cleanliness, maintenance, repairs and refurbishment

O7:Train and manage kitchen team members to deliver a consistent and timely food production operation to meet the needs and expectations of the customer and business, including adherence to brand standards where appropriate
O7:Effectively manage kitchen equipment and resources in line with legislative and operational requirements. Ensure regular servicing and maintenance has minimal impact on operations
O7:Manage food safety systems to adhere to legislation. Ensure that all required procedures, training and monitoring documentation are completed within timescales and issues addressed as appropriate
O8:Multi-functional managers will be required to demonstrate competence against at least 50% of the skills, knowledge and behaviour in each of two functions above, as well as those detailed below:
O8:Plan, manage, evaluate and review the work of the team and use of resources across hospitality functions to ensure the right people and tools are in the right place at the right time.
O8:Manage the team and resources to ensure that the needs of the customer are met whilst maintaining business / brand standards
